title: Lymphocytes Development, Types and Function
author: zealina
description: Test your understanding of lymphocytes types, development and functions

questions.question: Small lymphocytes typically measure 10-12 Î¼m in diameter
The light and heavy chains of the immunoglobulins are coded on Chromosome 8 and 14 respectively
The light and heavy chains of the immunoglobulins are coded on Chromosome 14 and 8 respectively
Natural Killer T cells express both TCR and NK receptors
The cytoplasm of lymphocytes often stains red in fixed preparations
Prothymocytes undergo positive selection in the bone marrow and negative selection in the thymus
Lymphocytes have high cytoplasm to nuclear ratio
Secondary lymphoid organs are sites where lymphocytes encounter antigens
The pre-B cell is the earliest recognizable precursor of a B cell
The spleen, Peyer's patch and thymus are secondary lymphoid organs
Lymphatic channels moves the prothymocyte to the Thymus
